com.jgefroh.core
Interface ISystem

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractSystem
public interface ISystem

The interface for a System.

A System provides a specific piece of functionality by providing the logic that manipulates the data in certain Components.

Systems use InfoPacks in order to access the data that specific Components contain. Systems should attempt to minimize their dependencies on other Systems and focus on providing a single, small piece of functionality as part of an overall "assembly line" of Systems.

Since:
0.1.0
Version:
0.1.0
Author:
Joseph Gefroh
See Also:
IInfoPack

Method Detail

init

void init()
Initializes this System with default values.

start

void start()
Sets the flag that marks this System as ready. This method is called automatically by Core when it begins tracking this System.

work

void work(long now)
Executes this System's work if it is ready. This method is called automatically by Core.

Parameters:
now - the current time

stop

void stop()
Sets the flag that marks this System as not ready. This method is called automatically by Core when it stops tracking this System.

setWait

void setWait(long waitTime)
Sets the number of ms this System will wait between executions.

Parameters:
waitTime - the number of ms to wait before doing work

setLast

void setLast(long last)
Sets the time this System was last run.

Parameters:
last - the time this System was last run, in ms

getWait

long getWait()
Gets the number of ms this System between executions.

getLast

Gets the time, in ms, this System was last executed.

Returns:
the time, in ms, of last execution

Sends a message to this System.
